item.description:
Presented by ASMPNE photo by Mauricio Handler

Renowned National Geographic underwater photographer and ASMP NE chapter's own Brian Skerry will take you around the world and into the sea sharing tales from many of his feature stories for National Geographic magazine. In his program Ocean Soul, which is also the name of his new book, Skerry will reveal rarely seen behaviors of marine wildlife and shed light on places never dived before. Brian Skerry doesn't always like what he encounters. A major focus of Brian’s work in recent years has been to produce stories that both celebrate the sea and raise awareness about it's problems. Concerned with the survival of our oceans, Brian talks about environmental problems and solutions. These are illustrated in his work as audiences are brought eye-to-eye with amazing marine animals and exotic locations from diving beneath arctic ice to the world’s most remote tropical coral reefs. Brian also shares tales behind his photographs, talking about how his images are made and the adventures of life in the field. Brian Skerry is clearly a photographer who has followed his passion.

 

To learn more about Brian Skerry visit his web site: brianskerry.com.

 

Registration Prices Pre-registered At the Door Members $0 Students/Assistants $10 Non-Members $20 Members $15 Students/Assistants $20 Non-Members $35

 

When And Where Date Location Registration  12/13/2011 
7:00 PM – 9:00 PM 
(Social time starts at 6:00 PM) Waltham, MA
EP Levine
219 Bear Hill Road

Click Here to Registerhttp://asmpne.org/articles/brian-skerry-ocean-soul.html

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: ASMP Presents Brian Skerry: Ocean Soul- Underwater photographer
